definitions.definition: the measurement from one side of something to the other; how wide something is

examples.text: The terrace runs **the full width of** the house.
It's about ten metres in width.
The carpet is available in different widths.
The boots are available in a choice of width fittings.
The car is 1.775 m in width.
The road narrows to a width of just four metres.
The snow had narrowed the width of the road to a single track.
The windows have a width of six feet.
a platform that spanned the width of the room
the great width of his shoulders
Height: 210 mm. Width: 57 mm. Length: 170 mm.
The pattern goes across the full width of the material.
The fabric is only available in a narrow width.

definitions.definition: a piece of material of a particular width

examples.text: You'll need two widths of fabric for each curtain.

definitions.definition: the distance between the two long sides of a swimming pool

examples.text: How many widths can you swim?

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from wide + -th, on the pattern of breadth (replacing wideness).
